content.question: Which of the following can be deduced from the maps above, which chart population density and taxation in sixteenth-century Castile?

choices.label: Southeastern Castile was sparsely populated and paid proportionally more taxes.
Northern Castile was most densely populated and heavily taxed.
The rural areas of Castile were densely populated, heavily taxed, and had higher mortality rates.
The poor lived in the northern urban areas and were heavily taxed.
The consumption tax was distributed evenly across the population.

content.answer: Southeastern Castile was sparsely populated and paid proportionally more taxes.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe a claim and/or argument in a text-based or non-text-based source.
